aukpy package

Submodules

aukpy.config module

aukpy.db module

Tools for building a sqlite database containing the eBird dataset. The full dataset is distributed as a ~400GB csv file, much of which is redundant. We store it in a fully normalized sqlite file instead, which reduces the size of the data and makes querying it much faster.

aukpy.db.build_db_incremental(input_path: Path, output_path: Path, max_size: int = 1000000) → Connection

Build a database incrementally. Useful for very large observation files (>10GB).

Parameters

  • input_path (Path) – Path to the CSV of observations.

  • output_path (Path) – Location to store the database.

  • max_lines (int, optional) – The maximum number of bytes of the CSV to read at a time.

aukpy.db.build_db_pandas(input_path: Path, output_path: Optional[Path] = None) → Connection

Build a sqlite database using pandas to parse the CSV

Parameters

  • input_path (Path) – Path to the CSV of observations

  • output_path (Optional[Path], optional) – Location to store the database. DB will be built in memory if None Defaults to None.

Returns

A connection to the finished database.

Return type

sqlite3.Connection

aukpy.db.undo_compression(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame

Undo the data compression performed when storing the dataframe in sqlite. Mostly this is just converting things back into strings

class aukpy.queries.Query(row_filters: ~typing.List[~aukpy.queries.Filter] = <factory>, row_filter: ~typing.Optional[~aukpy.queries.Filter] = None)

Bases: object

A wrapper around a set of filters for each table

bbox(min_long: float = -180.0, min_lat: float = -90.0, max_long: float = 180.0, max_lat: float = 90.0) → Query

Filter for observations within a bounding box.

bcr(code: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter by BCR code

breeding(breeding_code: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter observations on breeding code.

Parameters

breeding_code – A breeding code or codes to filter on

complete() → Query
country(names: Union[str, Iterable[str]], replace: bool = True) → Query

Filter by country name or country code.

date(after: Optional[str] = None, before: Optional[str] = None) → Query

Filter for a specific set of dates At least one of after or before must not be None :param after: The start of the date range. Should be in year-month-day format. Defaults to None (no minimum date). :param before: The end of the date range. Should be in year-month-day format. Defaults to None (no maximum date).

distance(minimum: float = 0.0, maximum: float = 1000000000.0, unit: Literal['km', 'miles'] = 'km') → Query

Filter on the distance traveled during the observation period.

Parameters

  • minimum – The minimum distance to accept. If 0, ‘stationary’ observations are also accepted.

  • maximum – The maximum distance to accept.

  • unit – The unit of distance, either ‘km’ or ‘miles’. Defaults to ‘km’

duration(minimum: float = 0, maximum: Optional[float] = None) → Query

Filter on the duration of the observation period, in minutes. :param minimum: The minimum duration time. :param maximum: The maximum duration time. Defaults to no upper bound.

get_query() → Tuple[str, Tuple[Any, ...]]
last_edited(after: Optional[str] = None, before: Optional[str] = None) → Query

Filter for edits between a range of dates. At least one of after or before must not be None :param after: The start of the date range. Should be in year-month-day format. Defaults to None (no minimum date). :param before: The end of the date range. Should be in year-month-day format. Defaults to None (no maximum date).

project(project: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter for observations that are part of a particular project.

Parameters

project – The name of the project

protocol(protocol: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter for observations obtained using a particular protocol. The most common protocols are stationary, traveling, and casual.

Parameters

protocol – The protocol or protocols to filter for

row_filter: Optional[Filter] = None
row_filters: List[Filter]
run(db_conn: Connection) → List[Tuple[Any, ...]]

Execute the query, returning the raw data

run_pandas(db_conn: Connection) → DataFrame

Execute the query, returning the results as a dataframe

species(names: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter by species name. Can be any of scientific name, common name, subspecies scientific name, or subspecies common name.

Parameters

names – A name or names.

state(names: Union[str, Iterable[str]]) → Query

Filter by state name or state code.

time(after: str = '00:00', before: str = '23:59') → Query

Select observations started between the given hours.

Parameters

  • after – The minimum start time of the observation event. Should be a string in 24 hour format.

  • before – The maximum start time of the observation event. Should be a string in 24 hour format.

Returns

A query object that will select the relevant observations.

Return type

Query
